entry.title: Every Inch of You
entry.summary:
Author: acatcam

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 33,413Chapters: 23/?Kudos: 289

Summary: "This is a love story." | "This is a detective story" When Clark Kent follows a story into Gotham, he doesnât expect to find himself face-to-face with the cityâs true guardian: a bat with fangs, claws, and a half-feral silhouette in the shadows. Suspicious, circling him like prey, Batman tests every ounce of Clarkâs resolveâonly for Clarkâs clumsy optimism to slip through anyway (âWhat the hay, are those fangs?â). Between the silk shawls and champagne smiles of Bruce Wayne, Gothamâs Pretty Boy Playboy, and the smudged-eyeliner hunger of the Bat with Fangs, Clark finds himself drawn to bothâthe golden boy in the sun and the monster in the dark. He doesnât break Bruceâs walls with force, but with patience, reverence, and devotion. The monster who refuses to hurt the one he loves, and the hero who would even offer his own blood to keep him alive.

entry.summary:
Author: alohamoron

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 46,678Chapters: 9/?Kudos: 417

Summary: Clark Kent is a clumsy journalist with a big problem. He has been obsessed with Gothamâs billionaire Bruce Wayne for months, and that obsession is slowly turning into something more like genuine romantic admiration. Determined to get closer, he hatches a plan to have Batman deliver his messages to Bruce Wayne without ever saying a word himself. Of course, nothing goes as planned. entry.title: Whatever happened to imaginary friends?
entry.summary:
Author: CoffeeTrees

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 76,428Chapters: 16/?Kudos: 1,227

Summary: Tim, the ever vigilant (always awake and never giving himself a break) vigilante, gets word of a drug bust going down. One he just so happens to be the only one available to stop. Which happens to be taking place in the very early hours of his birthday. Of course he goes on the highly dangerous bust alone. What could happen?Â Or: Tim is used to being the Robin that gets thing handled, that doesn't need Batman to come rescue him. Bruce Wayne had made it very clear in the early days that Tim was not his son. Alfred Pennyworth was cold, allowing only the politeness and distance to show through his Iron Wall. Dick Grayson treated him the way he wished he'd treated his brother, Jason.Tim was fine with this. He wasn't a child. Even if he wished for more of the small slivers of love the Wayne family were just starting to give him, he wouldn't dare take Jason Todd's place. He just hoped the support he provided for the grieving family would make Jason proud. But Jason Todd came back, and he sure made it known he wasn't. He made sure Tim knew exactly what he thought of the cuckoo in his family.Now, the Wayne family has their lost son back and Tim has a job to do. Just, not in this dimension?
